newsitem.title: USA: Ancor says shareholders' lawsuit meritless.
newsitem.headline: Ancor says shareholders' lawsuit meritless.

text.p: Ancor Communications Inc said late Tuesday that allegations contained in a lawsuit brought against it by two shareholders "are completely without merit."

The company said it intends to vigorously fight the lawsuit. The company also said will seek to hold plaintiffs liable for any costs it incurs in defending itself against the case including attorneys' fees.

The complaint, which seeks class status, alleges that the company made material misrepresentations related to a $30 million supply contract with Sequent Computer Systems Inc and the company's 1996 quarterly revenues.
"In our view this is a frivolous lawsuit," Chief Financial Officer Lee Lewis said in a statement.
Ancor provides high performance network backbone solutions.
